results.title: A Midsummer night's dream (BBC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
Shakespeare’s famous fantasy drama featuring Helen Mirren as Titania, Peter McEnery as Oberon, and Nigel Davenport as Theseus. No other credits available.

results.title: Measure for measure (BBC)
results.creator_credit: Desmond Davis, Cedric Messina and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
After deputising Angelo to enforce Vienna’s long ignored laws, Duke Vincentio purports to leave the city but actually remains to observe the proceedings, disguised as Friar Lodowick. Angelo revives an old statute against fornication and sentences Claudio to death for seducing Juliet, his betrothed. However, when Claudio’s sister Isabella, a religious novice, pleads for his life, her beauty so inflames Angelo’s own passions that he is very willing to ignore the law, promising her brother’s freedom if she yields to him. Vincentio, advises Isabella to pretend to cede to Angelo’s wishes. Once Vincentio reveals his true identity Angelo is severely castigated and ordered to marry Mariana to whom he was formerly betrothed.

results.title: The Taming of the shrew
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
Featuring John Cleese as Petruchio and Sarah Badel as Katherina. The action of “The Taming of the Shrew” is set in the social context of Elizabethan mercantile upper-middle class, and like nearly all of Shakespeare’s comedies, is a family play dealing with the domestic processes of courtship and marriage.

results.title: King Henry the Fourth. Part 2
results.creator_credit: David Giles, Cedric Messina and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
Featuring Jon Finch as King Henry IV, David Gwillim as Prince Hal, Anthony Quayle as Falstaff. Despite his success at Shrewsbury, King Henry has more insurrection to contend with. As the play closes, a reconciliation takes place between Henry and Prince Hal who, on the death of Henry, becomes the new King Henry V.

results.title: Othello
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
Featuring Anthony Hopkins as Othello, Bob Hoskins as Iago and Penelope Wilton as Desdemona. Jealousy and treachery fill this play as Iago, ensign to Othello, annoyed by Casio’s recent promotion as the Moor’s lieutenant, decides upon revenge. He sets out to destroy Othello’s relationship with Desdemona by telling her father that Othello has raped Desdemona; and the, when this falsehood has been overcome, spreads the myth of Casio and Desdemona’s love for each other. Iago’s treachery is eventually exposed but only after Othello has murdered Desdemona and then stabbed himself.

results.title: King Henry the Fourth. Part 1
results.creator_credit: David Giles, Cedric Messina and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
Featuring Jon Finch as King Henry IV, David Gwillim as Prince Hal, Anthony Quayle as Falstaff. Shakespeare’s play is the dark portrait of a king who comes to the throne with blood on his hands. Having killed Richard III, he is guilt-ridden in the knowledge of his foul deed. As a usurper he is now being plotted against by those who helped him to power.

results.title: King Lear (BBC)
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Miller, Shaun Sutton and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
This production of Shakespeare’s great play features Michael Hordern as King Lear, Michael Kitchen as Edmund, and Frank Middlenass as the Fool. “King Lear” is a tragedy that repeatedly portrays the restless intolerance of the young towards the old, the powerlessness of virtue in the face of deceit, and the fragility of the bonds which hold families and communities together. The production features an excellent Shakespearian cast.

results.title: Romeo and Juliet
results.creator_credit: Alvin Rakoff, Cedric Messina, Time-Life Television and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
Set in Verona during the Italian Renaissance this is the story of two young people whose families, the Montagues and the Capulets, are involved in a deep and bitter feud. Despite this enmity the youngsters fall in love and secretly marry. During a street brawl Romeo’s friend Mercurio is killed by Juliet’s cousin, Tybalt. Enraged by his friend’s death Romeo kills Tybalt and is banished from Verona. In desperation Juliet takes a sleeping potion, which induces a deathlike sleep. Romeo, hearing that she is dead takes his own life. Juliet upon rousing from her self-induced sleep and finding her lover dead, kills herself. The two houses of Montague and Capulet make a tardy sorrowful peace. Featuring Patrick Ryecart as Romeo, Rebecca Saire as Juliet and Michael Hordern as Capulet.

results.title: The Merchant of Venice
results.creator_credit: Jack Gold, Jonathon Miller, Time-Life Films and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
Antonio, a merchant of Venice, borrows money from the Jewish moneylender, Shylock, on behalf of his friend Bassanio, so that he may travel to Belmont to woo the wealthy Portia. A stipulation of this loan is that it must be repaid in full within three months, or Shylock will have a pound of the merchant’s flesh in lieu. About to wed Portia, Bassanio learns that the ships from which Antonio would have obtained the money to repay Shylock have been lost and that the usurer is demanding his pound of flesh. Bassanio returns to Venice to help his friend. Portia, without her husband knowing of her intentions, seeks legal advice, and appears at the trial disguised as a lawyer. Featuring Warren Mitchell as Shylock, Gemma Jones as Portia.

results.title: The Sentence of the court
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Scene”.
This docudrama looks at what the subsequent history might have been of the boys in the gang that attacked the conductor in the film the “Last Bus” (Title code 006006). Examines the factors which might have caused the boys behaviour, their likely punishment and its effect on them. Companion film to “Last Bus”.
